trans-unit.source: This topic shows you how to get a preview frame from the media capture preview stream.
trans-unit.target: This topic shows you how to get a preview frame from the media capture preview stream.

trans-unit.source: Get a preview frame
trans-unit.target: Get a preview frame

trans-unit.source: Get a preview frame
trans-unit.target: Get a preview frame

trans-unit.source: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
trans-unit.target: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

trans-unit.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132) \]
trans-unit.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132) \]

trans-unit.source: This topic shows you how to get a preview frame from the media capture preview stream.
trans-unit.target: This topic shows you how to get a preview frame from the media capture preview stream.

trans-unit.source: Note
trans-unit.target: Note

trans-unit.source: This article builds on concepts and code discussed in [Capture Photos and Video with MediaCapture](capture-photos-and-video-with-mediacapture.md), which describes the steps for implementing basic photo and video capture.
trans-unit.target: This article builds on concepts and code discussed in [Capture Photos and Video with MediaCapture](capture-photos-and-video-with-mediacapture.md), which describes the steps for implementing basic photo and video capture.

trans-unit.source: It is recommended that you familiarize yourself with the basic media capture pattern in that article before moving on to more advanced capture scenarios.
trans-unit.target: It is recommended that you familiarize yourself with the basic media capture pattern in that article before moving on to more advanced capture scenarios.

trans-unit.source: The code in this article assumes that your app already has an instance of MediaCapture that has been properly initialized and that you have a [**CaptureElement**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br209278) with an active video preview stream.
trans-unit.target: The code in this article assumes that your app already has an instance of MediaCapture that has been properly initialized and that you have a [**CaptureElement**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br209278) with an active video preview stream.

trans-unit.source: In addition to the namespaces required for basic media capture, capturing a preview frame requires the following namespace.
trans-unit.target: In addition to the namespaces required for basic media capture, capturing a preview frame requires the following namespace.

trans-unit.source: PreviewFrameUsing
trans-unit.target: PreviewFrameUsing

trans-unit.source: When you request a preview frame, you can specify the format in which you would like to receive the frame by creating a [**VideoFrame**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn930917) object with the format you desire.
trans-unit.target: When you request a preview frame, you can specify the format in which you would like to receive the frame by creating a [**VideoFrame**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn930917) object with the format you desire.

trans-unit.source: This example creates a video frame that is the same resolution as the preview stream by calling [**VideoDeviceController.GetMediaStreamProperties**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br211995) and specifying [**MediaStreamType.VideoPreview**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226640) to request the properties for the preview stream.
trans-unit.target: This example creates a video frame that is the same resolution as the preview stream by calling [**VideoDeviceController.GetMediaStreamProperties**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br211995) and specifying [**MediaStreamType.VideoPreview**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226640) to request the properties for the preview stream.

trans-unit.source: The width and height of the preview stream is used to create the new video frame.
trans-unit.target: The width and height of the preview stream is used to create the new video frame.

trans-unit.source: CreateFormatFrame
trans-unit.target: CreateFormatFrame

trans-unit.source: If your [**MediaCapture**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br241124) object is initialized and you have an active preview stream, call [**GetPreviewFrameAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn926711) to get a preview stream.
trans-unit.target: If your [**MediaCapture**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br241124) object is initialized and you have an active preview stream, call [**GetPreviewFrameAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn926711) to get a preview stream.

trans-unit.source: Pass in the video frame created in the last step to specify the format of the returned frame.
trans-unit.target: Pass in the video frame created in the last step to specify the format of the returned frame.

trans-unit.source: GetPreviewFrameAsync
trans-unit.target: GetPreviewFrameAsync

trans-unit.source: Get a [**SoftwareBitmap**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn887358) representation of the preview frame by accessing the [**SoftwareBitmap**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn930926) property of the [**VideoFrame**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn930917) object.
trans-unit.target: Get a [**SoftwareBitmap**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn887358) representation of the preview frame by accessing the [**SoftwareBitmap**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn930926) property of the [**VideoFrame**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn930917) object.

trans-unit.source: For information on saving, loading, and modifying software bitmaps, see [Imaging](imaging.md).
trans-unit.target: For information on saving, loading, and modifying software bitmaps, see [Imaging](imaging.md).

trans-unit.source: GetPreviewBitmap
trans-unit.target: GetPreviewBitmap

trans-unit.source: You can also get a [**IDirect3DSurface**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn965505) representation of the preview frame if you want to use the image with Direct3D APIs.
trans-unit.target: You can also get a [**IDirect3DSurface**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn965505) representation of the preview frame if you want to use the image with Direct3D APIs.

trans-unit.source: GetPreviewSurface
trans-unit.target: GetPreviewSurface

trans-unit.source: Important
trans-unit.target: Important

trans-unit.source: Either the [**SoftwareBitmap**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn930926) property or the [**Direct3DSurface**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn930920) property of the returned **VideoFrame** may be null depending on how you call **GetPreviewFrameAsync** and also depending on the device on which your app is running.
trans-unit.target: Either the [**SoftwareBitmap**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn930926) property or the [**Direct3DSurface**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn930920) property of the returned **VideoFrame** may be null depending on how you call **GetPreviewFrameAsync** and also depending on the device on which your app is running.

trans-unit.source: If you call the overload of [**GetPreviewFrameAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn926713) that accepts a **VideoFrame** argument, then the returned **VideoFrame** will have a non-null **SoftwareBitmap** and the **Direct3DSurface** property will be null.
trans-unit.target: If you call the overload of [**GetPreviewFrameAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn926713) that accepts a **VideoFrame** argument, then the returned **VideoFrame** will have a non-null **SoftwareBitmap** and the **Direct3DSurface** property will be null.

trans-unit.source: If you call the overload of [**GetPreviewFrameAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn926712) that has no arguments on a device that uses a Direct3D surface to represent the frame internally, the **Direct3DSurface** property will be non-null and the **SoftwareBitmap** property will be null.
trans-unit.target: If you call the overload of [**GetPreviewFrameAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn926712) that has no arguments on a device that uses a Direct3D surface to represent the frame internally, the **Direct3DSurface** property will be non-null and the **SoftwareBitmap** property will be null.

trans-unit.source: If you call the overload of [**GetPreviewFrameAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn926712) that has no arguments on a device that does not use a Direct3D surface to represent the frame internally, the **SoftwareBitmap** property will be non-null and the **Direct3DSurface** property will be null.
trans-unit.target: If you call the overload of [**GetPreviewFrameAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn926712) that has no arguments on a device that does not use a Direct3D surface to represent the frame internally, the **SoftwareBitmap** property will be non-null and the **Direct3DSurface** property will be null.

trans-unit.source: Your app should always check for a null value before trying to operate on the objects returned by the **SoftwareBitmap** or **Direct3DSurface** properties.
trans-unit.target: Your app should always check for a null value before trying to operate on the objects returned by the **SoftwareBitmap** or **Direct3DSurface** properties.

trans-unit.source: When you are done using the preview frame, be sure to call its [**Close**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn930918) method (projected to Dispose in C#) to free the resources used by the frame.
trans-unit.target: When you are done using the preview frame, be sure to call its [**Close**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn930918) method (projected to Dispose in C#) to free the resources used by the frame.

trans-unit.source: Or, use the **using** pattern, which automatically disposes of the object.
trans-unit.target: Or, use the **using** pattern, which automatically disposes of the object.

trans-unit.source: CleanUpPreviewFrame
trans-unit.target: CleanUpPreviewFrame
